review: Best toy of the year!  Super easy to set up and most apps activated and sync'ed quickly and easily.  Currently digging through my Prime stuff. author: L. Kramer

review: I loved it but had to return it and go back to Roku.Pros - it is lightling fast.  It plays pretty pictures when it's resting. Voice control is nice but only works in Amazon Prime.Cons-this is why I returned. You cannot enable pin-code ordering.  You click twice and you bought it.  My four year old keeps buying shows.  They refund when I send an email to complain, but it's a lot of hassle.  They told me that I could turn off one-click ordering on my Amazon account but that didn't work.  Then they admitted that there is no way to turn off 1-click ordering, except enabling full parental controls.  Full parental controls means that you enter a pincode for every single thing you watch.  Too much.The other problem is that eventually it stopped telling me what was and wasn't prime.  I would have to check on another device.  I accidently paid for something that was free on prime.  I bought the whole season because my kid likes it.  Then I found out on the kindle that this was a free show.  They seem to go out of their way to obscure what's free and what's not free.  Then it seemed to just be default charging me for prime shows.  I thought maybe it was broken that it wasn't recognizing my account.  I called tech support.  The guy was heavily accented and hard to understand.  Walked me through rebooting it, then said a tech support person would call me back in 3 days.  I plugged in the old Roku instead.  Amazon was nice about taking it back even though it was past the return date.Problem #3- cannot read the tiny text from my chair on the 35 inch TV.  Roku uses bigger fonts in the description.  I had to get up and stand close to the TV to know what I was selecting. You cannot adjust this text.Oh - free time - just an aside.  Not really worth it.  My kid not interested in any of that stuff.  The dregs of children programming past and very limited episodes of the good stuff. Free time is not a work-around for the one click ordering problem.I was sorry to see it go.  The Roku is really not as nice.  I miss the speed, mostly.  I might go back in a few years when they get the kinks worked out.

review: Good product if you're using the Amazon-preloaded apps. It supports third-party programs, but treats them as second class citizens, as Amazon doesn't allow you to pin them in the front page without sideloading another program. You have to upload them by clicking through their Apps maintenance menu... Kind of a hassle.The remote control (included) can use some improvements, to allow typing, instead of having to rely on another remote control.Memory is also a bit tight and could be improved.There is room for improvement.
